Net neutrality showdown day

With help from John Hendel

NET NEUTRALITY SHOWDOWN DAY — Senate Democrats are set to score a victory on net neutrality this afternoon in a showdown on the chamber floor, a move they believe will stir up passion among young voters ahead of the 2018 midterm elections, John reports.

TODAY: WYLIE GOES BEFORE SENATE JUDICIARY — Cambridge Analytica whistleblower Christopher Wylie, who revealed the Trump-linked firm improperly accessed the data of millions of Facebook users, will testify before the Senate Judiciary Committee this morning for a hearing on data privacy.

— A group of House Democrats, meanwhile, sent a follow-up letter to Attorney General Jeff Sessions pressing for information on Trump lawyer Rudy Giuliani’s claims (later walked back) that the president (not the Justice Department) shot down the AT&T-Time Warner merger.
